item.title: Microsoft Graph - Useful Functions
item.description:
Overview

Microsoft Graph has become a key SDK for Microsoft 365 developers. When I started my journey in using Microsoft Graph SDK, I had spent good amount of time in making these functions to work expected. Now pretty much using as an utility class in most of my projects.

Here are the list of functions which are available for you to use

  1. Create Authentication Provider
  2. Create Graph Client
  3. Get Sharepoint ID
  4. Get List ID
  5. Get Library ID
  6. Get File ID
  7. Get Folder ID
  8. Get File Content
  9. Move file from source to destination folder

Below code snippets are used to do most common useful operations in SharePoint using Microsoft Graph.

Create Authentication Provider

 1internal static IAuthenticationProvider CreateAuthorizationProvider(IConfigurationRoot config, string userName, SecureString userPassword)
 2{
 3    var configSection = config.GetSection(nameof(FileProcessConfig));
 4    _fileProcessConfig = configSection.Get<FileProcessConfig>();
 5
 6    var clientId = _fileProcessConfig.applicationId;
 7
 8    var authority = $"https://login.microsoftonline.com/{_fileProcessConfig.tenantId}/v2.0";
 9
10    List<string> scopes = new List<string>();
11    scopes.Add("User.Read");
12    scopes.Add("Files.Read");
13
14    var cca = PublicClientApplicationBuilder.Create(clientId)
15                                            .WithAuthority(authority)
16                                            .Build();
17    return MsalAuthenticationProvider.GetInstance(cca, scopes.ToArray(), userName, userPassword);
18}

Create Graph Client

 1internal static GraphServiceClient getGraphClient()
 2{
 3     var config = new ConfigurationBuilder()
 4                    .SetBasePath(System.IO.Directory.GetCurrentDirectory())
 5                    .AddJsonFile("appsettings.json")
 6                    .Build();
 7
 8    var authenticationProvider = CreateAuthorizationProvider(config, ReadUsername(), ReadPassword());
 9    var graphClient = new GraphServiceClient(authenticationProvider);
10    return graphClient;
11}
Get SharePoint Site ID:
 1internal static string GetSiteID()
 2{
 3    var siteMetaData = getGraphClient().Sites.GetByPath("sites/DemoMSGraphSharePoint","srinivasnarula.sharepoint.com")
 4                .Request()
 5                .Select(q => new
 6                {
 7                    q.Id
 8                })
 9                .GetAsync().Result;
10
11    return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(siteMetaData.Id) ? siteMetaData.Id.Split(',')[1] : null;
12}
Get SharePoint Library ID:
 1internal static string GetLibraryID(string siteID, string libraryName)
 2{
 3
 4    var libraryMetaData = getGraphClient().Sites[siteID].Drives
 5        .Request()
 6        .Select(sl => new
 7        {
 8            sl.Id,
 9            sl.Name
10        })
11        .GetAsync().Result;
12
13    return libraryMetaData.Where(x => x.Name == libraryName).Select(p => p.Id).FirstOrDefault();
14}
Get SharePoint List ID:
 1internal static string GetListID(string listName)
 2{
 3    var filterParam = string.Format("displayName eq '{0}'", listName);
 4
 5    var productIntroListInfo = getGraphClient().Sites.GetByPath("sites/DemoMSGraphSharePoint","srinivasnarula.sharepoint.com")
 6    .Lists
 7    .Request()
 8    .Select(pi => new
 9    {
10        pi.Id
11    })
12    .Filter(filterParam)
13    .GetAsync().Result;
14
15    return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(productIntroListInfo.Count.ToString()) ? productIntroListInfo.CurrentPage[0].Id : string.Empty;
16}
Get File ID:
 1internal static string GetFileID(string siteID, string libraryID,string filePathandFileName)
 2{
 3    try
 4    {
 5        var sourceFileID = getGraphClient().Sites[siteID]
 6                .Drives[libraryID]
 7                .Root.ItemWithPath(filePathandFileName)
 8                .Request()
 9                .Select(fl => new
10                {
11                    fl.Id
12                })
13                .GetAsync().Result;
14
15        return sourceFileID.Id.ToString();
16    }
17    catch (Exception ex)
18    {
19        Console.WriteLine("Exception at GetFileID :" + ex.StackTrace);
20        throw ex;
21    }
22    
23}
Get Folder ID:
 1internal static string GetFolderID(string siteID, string libraryID, string folderName)
 2{
 3    try
 4    {
 5        var sourceFileID = getGraphClient().Sites[siteID]
 6                .Drives[libraryID].Search(folderName)
 7                .Request()
 8                .GetAsync().Result;
 9
10        return sourceFileID.Select(x => x.Id).FirstOrDefault();
11    }
12    catch (Exception ex)
13    {
14        Console.WriteLine("Exception thrown at GetFileID :" + ex.StackTrace);
15        throw ex;
16    }
17
18}
Get File Content:
 1internal static Stream GetFileContent(string siteID, string libraryID, string filePathandFileName)
 2{
 3    var fileContentRequest = getGraphClient().Sites[siteID]
 4                    .Drives[libraryID]
 5                    .Root.ItemWithPath(filePathandFileName)
 6                    .Content
 7                    .Request()
 8                    .GetAsync().Result;
 9
10    fileContentRequest.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin);
11
12    return fileContentRequest;
13}
Move File to Different Folder:
 1internal static bool moveFile(string siteID, string libraryID, string sourceFileID, string destinationFolderID, string destinationFileName)
 2{
 3
 4    var driveItem = new DriveItem
 5    {
 6        ParentReference = new ItemReference
 7        {
 8            Id = destinationFolderID
 9        },
10        Name = destinationFileName
11    };
12
13    try
14    {
15        getGraphClient()
16        .Sites[siteID]
17        .Drives[libraryID]
18        .Items[sourceFileID]
19        .Request()
20        .UpdateAsync(driveItem).GetAwaiter().GetResult();
21
22        return true;
23
24    }
25    catch (Exception ex)
26    {
27        Console.WriteLine(ex.Message);
28        return false;
29    }
30}

All these functions are avialble in console application for you to do an ready test. Please feel free to download from the given link.
